GOD.content: Matthew: [on giving alms] “let not the left hand know…” [on sinning] “and if the right hand offend thee, cut it off”
GOD.linkedContent: Matthew: [on giving alms] “let not the left hand know…” [on sinning] “and if the right hand offend thee, cut it off”

GT.content: Heidegger on gift, Heidegger uncovers an etymology of khreon that links it to hand, to reaching for, also links it to logos > Derrida wonders about credit cards, coded signatures
GT.linkedContent: Heidegger on gift, Heidegger uncovers an etymology of khreon that links it to hand, to reaching for, also links it to logos > Derrida wonders about credit cards, coded signatures

SPOM.content: via Marx, practical events, where thought becomes act (se fait agir); thought as Handeln in Heidegger
SPOM.linkedContent: via Marx, practical events, where thought becomes act (se fait agir); thought as Handeln in Heidegger

HERP.content: acc. Heidegger, dual hands, dual ears [ontic?], single hands, single ears [ontological: hear, give?] > passage from plural to singular is essential
HERP.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, dual hands, dual ears [ontic?], single hands, single ears [ontological: hear, give?] > passage from plural to singular is essential

S.content: for Heidegger [Heidegger’s Hand], pragma, praxism, pragmata present themselves as vorhandene, zuhandene > all in domain of hand, that is, human (writing is handwriting)
S.linkedContent: for Heidegger [Heidegger’s Hand], pragma, praxism, pragmata present themselves as vorhandene, zuhandene > all in domain of hand, that is, human (writing is handwriting)

S.content: Heidegger’s discourse [on hand], all the more peremptory and authoritarian for hiding its discomfiture, preserves, sheltered in obscurity, the profoundest metaphysical humanism
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s discourse [on hand], all the more peremptory and authoritarian for hiding its discomfiture, preserves, sheltered in obscurity, the profoundest metaphysical humanism

S.content: silent play of quotation marks [re: spirit], Anführungsstriche, Anführungszeichen, “the hand calculates very fast,” Anführen, to conduct, dupe, brainwash, silent contrivances, fort/da, what shows or hides changes everything, and when one puts away after exhibiting, this is mise au pas (bringing to heel)
S.linkedContent: silent play of quotation marks [re: spirit], Anführungsstriche, Anführungszeichen, “the hand calculates very fast,” Anführen, to conduct, dupe, brainwash, silent contrivances, fort/da, what shows or hides changes everything, and when one puts away after exhibiting, this is mise au pas (bringing to heel)

OH.content: Derrida will subscribe to European analogic (ideality, capitalization) w/ one hand, write outside it w/ the other
OH.linkedContent: Derrida will subscribe to European analogic (ideality, capitalization) w/ one hand, write outside it w/ the other

FSW.content: two hands needed to operate Freud’s Mystic Pad

T.content: how to put one’s hands on tympanum so it can escape from hands of philosopher, so he can no longer recognize his phallogocentrism [play w/ mains, maintenant, maintain], no longer rediscover himself, no longer able to say: I will have anticipated it w/ absolute knowledge
T.linkedContent: how to put one’s hands on tympanum so it can escape from hands of philosopher, so he can no longer recognize his phallogocentrism [play w/ mains, maintenant, maintain], no longer rediscover himself, no longer able to say: I will have anticipated it w/ absolute knowledge

T.content: like w/ Mystic Pad, question of writing machine should upset (devrait fair basculer) space of proper body dans l’entraînement sans limite des machines de machines et donc de machines à main coupée
T.linkedContent: like w/ Mystic Pad, question of writing machine should upset (devrait fair basculer) space of proper body dans l’entraînement sans limite des machines de machines et donc de machines à main coupée

T.content: intro to differance, cites, repercusses its rhythm w/out measure, incision conduite par une main aveugle pour n’avoir jamais vu que le part-et-d’autre d’un tissu > to weave (tramer) doesn’t play le jeu d’enchaînement, il joue l’enchaînement, trouer, traverser, works on both sides (le part-et-d’autre), leaves ear canal open, sous le coup d’un enchaînement simulé, non-echo
T.linkedContent: intro to differance, cites, repercusses its rhythm w/out measure, incision conduite par une main aveugle pour n’avoir jamais vu que le part-et-d’autre d’un tissu > to weave (tramer) doesn’t play le jeu d’enchaînement, il joue l’enchaînement, trouer, traverser, works on both sides (le part-et-d’autre), leaves ear canal open, sous le coup d’un enchaînement simulé, non-echo

SH.content: hand to hand, hands are given too, what is sundered gathers itself in name, alliance, pledge, promise, symbol
SH.linkedContent: hand to hand, hands are given too, what is sundered gathers itself in name, alliance, pledge, promise, symbol

OS.content: MOP, privilege of presence, already marked in Parmenides: time, given by hand, pure maintaining (reinen “Gegenwärtigens”), pure making-present (maintenant, Vorhandenheit)
OS.linkedContent: MOP, privilege of presence, already marked in Parmenides: time, given by hand, pure maintaining (reinen “Gegenwärtigens”), pure making-present (maintenant, Vorhandenheit)

OS.content: l’autre geste, le plus difficile, le plus inouï, le plus questionnant, celui pour lequel nous sommes le moins préparé, can only be sketched (esquisser), announced in calculated fissures of metaphysical text: 2 texts, 2 hands, 2 visions (together simultaneously & separated)
OS.linkedContent: l’autre geste, le plus difficile, le plus inouï, le plus questionnant, celui pour lequel nous sommes le moins préparé, can only be sketched (esquisser), announced in calculated fissures of metaphysical text: 2 texts, 2 hands, 2 visions (together simultaneously & separated)

P.content: colossal: that which (or presentation of that which) can be taken in hand [Fassen] or eye w/out possibility of being taken, thus crushes you not w/out pleasure, elevates you
P.linkedContent: colossal: that which (or presentation of that which) can be taken in hand [Fassen] or eye w/out possibility of being taken, thus crushes you not w/out pleasure, elevates you

POS.content: double play [double hands] rigorously respects philosophemes to the point of their nonpertinence, exhaustion, closure
POS.linkedContent: double play [double hands] rigorously respects philosophemes to the point of their nonpertinence, exhaustion, closure

OTO.content: institutions of “yes,” have need of ears: Nietzsche doesn’t expect the ears and hands for his truths today—my small ears no small interest to ladies, makes me a monster, anti-ass, Anti-Christ
OTO.linkedContent: institutions of “yes,” have need of ears: Nietzsche doesn’t expect the ears and hands for his truths today—my small ears no small interest to ladies, makes me a monster, anti-ass, Anti-Christ

SW.content: after Cixous’ laser surgery, she realizes eyes touch, eyes are hands/lips [lips associated w/ language in Hebrew]
SW.linkedContent: after Cixous’ laser surgery, she realizes eyes touch, eyes are hands/lips [lips associated w/ language in Hebrew]

DPi.content: guillotine: [doesn’t erase or dry up blood but keeps it] withdraws hands of man
DPi.linkedContent: guillotine: [doesn’t erase or dry up blood but keeps it] withdraws hands of man

DPi.content: guillotine: gets rid of bloody hands of executioner (bourreau)
DPi.linkedContent: guillotine: gets rid of bloody hands of executioner (bourreau)

RGE.content: Bataille: “keep in one hand what the other gives” (to possess ruins is not to possess nothing)
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille: “keep in one hand what the other gives” (to possess ruins is not to possess nothing)

REST.content: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)

AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: “sensation becomes idea only by force of touch,” every touch representative of objects the hand holds; sensation of solidity: both idea and feeling, idea as feeling in soul that relates to something outside

+R.content: [Derrida on 2 hands] > to write one must be several
+R.linkedContent: [Derrida on 2 hands] > to write one must be several

+R.content: each letter, bit or piece of word (mors ou morceau de mot) written w/ 2 hands, twice two hands, on each page
+R.linkedContent: each letter, bit or piece of word (mors ou morceau de mot) written w/ 2 hands, twice two hands, on each page

C.content: primordial place of “father” (presumed paradigm) depends on cartouche-performance—takes w/ one hand what it gives w/ the other (torturous surgery)
C.linkedContent: primordial place of “father” (presumed paradigm) depends on cartouche-performance—takes w/ one hand what it gives w/ the other (torturous surgery)

LI.content: this other hand, marked by Derrida’s false-start, dictated Reply to 3 + n authors [?]
LI.linkedContent: this other hand, marked by Derrida’s false-start, dictated Reply to 3 + n authors [?]

LI.content: iterability disrupts presence, unity of ego in sender, du maintenant-écrivain (grasping w/ 1 hand his ballpoint pen) > stigmè of every mark already split
LI.linkedContent: iterability disrupts presence, unity of ego in sender, du maintenant-écrivain (grasping w/ 1 hand his ballpoint pen) > stigmè of every mark already split

TN.content: for Kant, touch is only immediate sense, founds other 2 objective senses: sight & hearing > hierarchical privilege of touch; touch occurs in fingers, fingertips [“haptocentric” tradition]
TN.linkedContent: for Kant, touch is only immediate sense, founds other 2 objective senses: sight & hearing > hierarchical privilege of touch; touch occurs in fingers, fingertips [“haptocentric” tradition]

TN.content: for Kant, only man has hand (telos): allows us to explore form, whereas coldness, heat, softness are just “vital”
TN.linkedContent: for Kant, only man has hand (telos): allows us to explore form, whereas coldness, heat, softness are just “vital”

TN.content: touch gives nearness/proximity more than sight/hearing > proximity, proper, present
TN.linkedContent: touch gives nearness/proximity more than sight/hearing > proximity, proper, present

TN.content: one thinks first of all, and too much, of hands: take the gift (“Tiens!”), comprehension, prehension, captation, a plea (prière) > “tender extending” becomes violence itself: “Take that!”
TN.linkedContent: one thinks first of all, and too much, of hands: take the gift (“Tiens!”), comprehension, prehension, captation, a plea (prière) > “tender extending” becomes violence itself: “Take that!”

TN.content: operation that inscribed some touching in all writing, surg-ical, Greek cheirourgia, cheir (hand), ergon (work) > even if machines/technology are indispensable
TN.linkedContent: operation that inscribed some touching in all writing, surg-ical, Greek cheirourgia, cheir (hand), ergon (work) > even if machines/technology are indispensable

TN.content: to follow the history of touch, follow the hand as a sample (échantillon), more or less well sewn, following like un fil conducteur, follow the turns of the hand, and especially its finger > see what it circumscribes, and what it lets slip away (laisse échapper)
TN.linkedContent: to follow the history of touch, follow the hand as a sample (échantillon), more or less well sewn, following like un fil conducteur, follow the turns of the hand, and especially its finger > see what it circumscribes, and what it lets slip away (laisse échapper)

TN.content: objectivity of being(s): 1) exposed before a gaze 2) opposes a resistance to touch > does the hand (being-before-the-hand) reconcile these two positional values of objectivity?
TN.linkedContent: objectivity of being(s): 1) exposed before a gaze 2) opposes a resistance to touch > does the hand (being-before-the-hand) reconcile these two positional values of objectivity?

TN.content: Diderot, in tradition of Anaxagoras: “man thinks because he has hands”
TN.linkedContent: Diderot, in tradition of Anaxagoras: “man thinks because he has hands”

TN.content: via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance
TN.linkedContent: via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance

TN.content: hierarchy/teleology [au sommet]: willing subject, quasi-sense that is touch (ultrasense), the hand [the whole hand, not just tip of an extremely pointy fingernail (ongle extrêmement aigu)]
TN.linkedContent: hierarchy/teleology [au sommet]: willing subject, quasi-sense that is touch (ultrasense), the hand [the whole hand, not just tip of an extremely pointy fingernail (ongle extrêmement aigu)]

TN.linkedContent: Maine de Biran’s “humanualism (humainisme)”: only humans have hand, can touch in strongest sense (that elephant trunk “approximates” hand of man maintains hierarchy)

TN.content: hand, humanism, continuistic intuitionism, natural immediacy > so many celebrations of touching
TN.linkedContent: hand, humanism, continuistic intuitionism, natural immediacy > so many celebrations of touching

TN.content: for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure
TN.linkedContent: for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure

TN.content: “transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism
TN.linkedContent: “transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism

TN.content: Ravaisson doesn’t even stop at hand, his spiritualism/finalism overflows humanity of human (thus the hand), ontoteleology of life, ontotheology of desire/grace (freedom of spirit)
TN.linkedContent: Ravaisson doesn’t even stop at hand, his spiritualism/finalism overflows humanity of human (thus the hand), ontoteleology of life, ontotheology of desire/grace (freedom of spirit)

TN.content: Ravaisson’s withdrawal of hand, does it get replaced, secretly, w/ hand of God? how does this figure of God’s hand relate to light, to flesh, to Incarnation, to Christ’s touch?
TN.linkedContent: Ravaisson’s withdrawal of hand, does it get replaced, secretly, w/ hand of God? how does this figure of God’s hand relate to light, to flesh, to Incarnation, to Christ’s touch?

TN.linkedContent: Husserl offers hand as an example of free, spontaneous, immediate movement of ego-subject

TN.content: for Husserl, fingers that touch (not signal, not show) deem contact the experience of presence, which is full, immediate, direct (Nancy’s syncope interrupts)
